title: Configure Aviator
content:
Configure Aviator

To configure the settings for the Aviator capability, follow these steps:

  1. Sign in to the agent interface.
  2. From the main menu, choose Administration > Configuration > AI Studio > Virtual Agent.
  3. Click the Configurations tab and locate the Virtual agent setting section.
  4. To change the name for the Aviator capability, enter your desired name in the Name field. The default value is Aviator. This name will be used within answers, such as a greeting message, generated by Aviator.
  5. To change the avatar, click the current avatar and browse for another image that's saved on your computer. Select your new image and click Open.
    The default avatar is . The supported image types include JPG, PNG, and GIF. The maximum file size is 2 MB and the recommended image dimension is 200 x 200 px.
  6. In the Greeting words field, enter one or more greeting sentences as needed.
  7. In the Information security tips field, type one or more security tips that grab users' attention. These sentences will appear at the beginning of a conversation above the user's input message.
  8. To allow for user feedback on the responses of the Aviator service, toggle on Enable feedback.
  9. To change the warning message that appears when Aviator can't find any reference for the user's request, update the No reference warning field.
  10. To change the disclaimer message, update the Disclaimer field.
  11. Click Save to save your settings.

Configure business rules for Aviator use cases

A number of use cases for Aviator are available out of the box. Adoption of these use cases is optional. For more information about these use cases, see Use Aviator in the Agent interface. Some of these use cases depend on business rules and custom actions that you must add manually. 

Prepare an integration user

For the Aviator business rules to work, Integration Studio provides an Aviator integration with the Call Aviator with record data and Call Aviator with record and search data scenarios out of the box. You need to configure the integration by following these steps.

Create an integration user

For SaaS customers, contact the SaaS Ops team to create an integration user and share the credential information with you.

For on-premises customers, contact your suite admin to create an integration user.

To customize the name of the integration user, the tenant admin can go to the General tab of the integration user record in Agent Interface (Administration > Master Data > People > People) and update the Name field.

Assign permissions to integration user

To use the Aviator business rules, the integration user needs these permissions: Administrator and Log into the application.

  1. Log in to Agent Interface as the tenant admin.
  2. From the main menu, choose Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.
  3. Click Add to create a role (for example, Aviator user). Alternatively, you can use an existing role.
  4. Select the role and assign Log into the application permission in the General section and the Administrator permission in the Aviator section to this role.

Add required roles to the integration user

Besides the role dedicated to the integration user, you need to add all the other roles of record types for which you want to use the Aviator business rules.

  1. Click the People tab, locate the integration user, and click it.
  2. On the General tab page, locate the System use definitions section and select all the required roles from the Role drop-down list.

    For example, if you want to use the business rule for Service requests, Incidents, Problems, and Changes, you need to add Aviator user (earlier created for the integration user), Service Request Coordinator, Incident Analyst, Problem Analyst, and Change Coordinator to the integration user.

    To add roles for other record types, ensure that these roles have View, Update, and Comment permissions for the respective record types.

  3. Save the settings.

Configure integration user in Integration Studio

When the integration user is assigned all the roles and permissions, configure it in the Aviator integration and activate this integration.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration and select Integration Studio from the drop-down list of Integration Management.
  2. Click the Aviator integration.
  3. In the Details section, click  at the end of the Current system integration user field.
  4. In the Credentials dialog box that opens, specify the username and password of your integration user and click OK.
  5. Select Active to activate the integration.
  6. Save the settings.

Enable Aviator business rules in AI Studio

After your integration user is configured within the integration, you need to allow Aviator to manage backend data based on established business rules.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Configuration > AI Studio > Configurations.
  2. Toggle on Enable Aviator in the backend.
  3. Save the setting.

Configure Aviator use cases

Now, you can go to Studio and configure the Aviator business rules for the required record types. You can configure the rules in both Studio and task plans for various use cases, including risk assessment, sentiment analysis, and knowledge creation. This enables IT agents to expedite decision-making processes and enhance overall operational efficiency.

  • Call Aviator with record data
  • Call Aviator with record and search data

For required configurations for certain Aviator use cases, see Configure Aviator use cases.

Verify business rule configuration

You can define a custom action to check if the Aviator business rule works correctly. For more information on how to create a custom action, see Custom actions.

Troubleshoot Aviator business rules

If the Aviator business rule fails to run properly, error messages will be recorded in the Discussions tab of a record. 

For more information about the errors, check the logs in Integration Studio. To do this:

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration and select Integration Studio from the drop-down list of Integration Management.
  2. Click the Aviator integration.
  3. Click Execution history. 
  4. In the log list, click the UUID of a log to view the details.

Export user feedback

If Enable feedback is toggled on, user feedback will be collected in the Reports module in Agent Interface. You can create feedback reports and configure workflow rules to manage user feedback.

Don't customize the workflow for the VirtualAgentFeedback record type in Studio because it might change in future releases.

To export the data, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to Agent Interface.
  2. Click the main menu icon in the upper left corner and then click Reports.
  3. In the search box, type "end user" to search for the End user feedback in past month report. Then, click it.
  4. Export the data to your desired file format.
